EDITS: [b]added the bank and Frell, because lots of people know them (i suppose). [/b] [b]Added Exe262 and Greeny[/b]
Whats with all the CM's and Section mods getting muted/modded/warned, etc?
Like all of the sudden it seems left and right CM's are getting infracted. Just wondering, what's with that? :o

item.title: Uhh O.o
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You’re a bit radical in the way you go about dealing with issues. Which is good in some situations, and also the worst possible thing in others. Which would be perfect considering some of the other staff members are the opposite.

Read full topic

item.title: Uhh O.o
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:90, topic:250420”][quote]
Of course, Greeny is a bit on the[/quote][/quote]

Oh my gucking fod, the tension is killing me…! FINISH THE SENTENCE. FINISH THE DAMN SENTENCE AAAAHHHH!

I think Thug-life’s post mimicked a lot of what mine said a page or so back, although where I was aiming for improvement he’s saying lets slacken the belt and sit back. I’d be happy with either approach, but for my previously stated reasons - we can’t stay where we are now.

I also completely agree with what Thug-life said about me and vice versa, a year or so ago we’d be happily holding hands in #mopar, it just got a bit ugly recently.

Read full topic

item.title: Uhh O.o
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:92, topic:250420”]I didn’t really decide to “step down” because of what happened here, more so i just used this as an excuse to get out. I don’t have a problem with the community or any of the staff, i don’t have a problem with Greeny - i like him as a person, just i somehow managed to bump heads with him and things got a bit ugly.

The way i see it, is everyone is trying to make this community into something it never will be simply due to the user base and the type of people it attracts. What i say is this community needs to relax a little more, the rules over here on mitb need to be less strict - all the staff should be here for is making sure that it stays that way by dealing with the trouble makers.

Over and out.[/quote]

Yeh what he said.

Read full topic

item.title: Uhh O.o
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I didn’t really decide to “step down” because of what happened here, more so i just used this as an excuse to get out. I don’t have a problem with the community or any of the staff, i don’t have a problem with Greeny - i like him as a person, just i somehow managed to bump heads with him and things got a bit ugly.

The way i see it, is everyone is trying to make this community into something it never will be simply due to the user base and the type of people it attracts. What i say is this community needs to relax a little more, the rules over here on mitb need to be less strict - all the staff should be here for is making sure that it stays that way by dealing with the trouble makers.

Over and out.

Read full topic

item.title: Uhh O.o
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I was typing something for this topic yesterday, and I was so tired it was taking too long to type it. So I have a copy of it in Notepad, so I’ll quote it. It doesn’t really solve any problems, I was getting to that part. I may finish it, I doubt anyone will care to read it but even still.

Having been a long time member of Moparisthebest, I think I might be entitled to an opinion of the staff, and the current state of the community. I feel that Secet is right, we all need to grow up. I've done some maturing in the past few months myself. But I have much more room for improvement. It seems that all we do is complain and complain and complain. Yet even now, after nearly two full months of complaining, nothing has changed. Other than people's stances in the argument.

I am one of the people whose stance in the argument has changed. I used to think that the staff were almost always wrong in their decisions. And that the warns/moderations/mutes that were given were totally unjust. And sometimes they were. But I don’t feel the same way anymore, I feel that the staff are doing the best job they can given the current state of the forums.

Of course I do have some complaints. Some of the warnings/moderations/mutes were a bit unfair. Especially for Greeny’, Yz’, and frank_’. My topic 'How do you feel about the staff" was a prime example of that. It’s obvious that the staff is lacking some objectivity. I believe that if Greeny were to become a Global Moderator, there would be more objectivity in the staff.

Of course, Greeny is a bit on the

Read full topic

item.title: Uhh O.o
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Tree:

@ On-Topic: There are basically two groups of staff member. The elitists and the anti-elitists. That about summarizes it. It’s just that more anti-elitists are in higher positions at the moment. A mixture of both makes a nice community.

I agree with this post however by being anti-elitist they’ve taken it to being overly hard on the elitists and less hard on the non-elitists. Hence role reversal and they become biased towards themselves in the same way elitists are biased to other elitists.

Note, a lot of the complaints of elitism and bad moderating revolve around me, however often it isn’t me directly committing the “crime” it’s just this role the community has assigned to me as being the antichrist. I’m seen as the apparent head of the elitists, something which I never claimed to be (I am of course overjoyed they think this ;)). The point is, I began jokingly the “Greeny movement” which then escalated to something much greater than it was ever meant to be, although I’m glad it did. Before me, it was Frank_, and amongst other elitists he still is the “head” of the campaign, as can be seen through his posts.

There is way too much support in the way of “the movement” is it is now seen to be called. You cannot abolish elitism - in the same way you can’t abolish communism, Judaism or one of the other annoying cultures on this planet. The process of change, requires adaptation and takes time but it also requires stimulus. As I’ve said before, the community will get worse before it gets better and it wont get any better unless something drastically changes in order to spark an adaptation in the members - my previous suggestions have been broadening the board away from Runescape&Moparscape but this isn’t the discussion for that.

My point being, us - the elitists have been around long enough to remember the golden days, the #kaitnieks days and such. We’re revolting in this time of depression, the issue being the community has been collapsing for a number of years now thus it seems like we’re just permanent cunts (whether this be poor forum management, lack of inspiration from members - who knows? I’m not going to pass judgment but I have my opinions.) It certainly isn’t member count as we have an enormous member base, apparently we’re appealing to the wrong types of people though. The point is, we (the elitists) want the old days back, they’re not coming but we’ll damn well crave for something as close as it gets. We are not ruining the forum, we want a better forum and as the most active, most intelligent and most experienced members you are doomed to fail without us and our support.

Read full topic
